intro: Boechera centrifendleri, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to cold, arid conditions. Its leaves are basal and rosette-like, and its flowers are white or pale yellow, arranged in a raceme. Boechera centrifendleri is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential for genetic research.
